top_categories.workout_context: Devils Cardigan rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Devils Cardigan when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Devils Cardigan’s tasmanian mountains, australian gravel demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Devils Cardigan. Make this intensity feel like home.
At 120 miles, Devils Cardigan punishes athletes who haven’t trained their body to produce power when glycogen runs low.
Racing Devils Cardigan isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Devils Cardigan’s 12,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Devils Cardigan’s tasmanian mountain gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Every session at Devils Cardigan intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Devils Cardigan — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Low-cadence force work builds the muscular strength for Devils Cardigan’s 12,000ft of climbing — especially the grinding, low-speed ascents.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Devils Cardigan — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Devils Cardigan’s 120 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Devils Cardigan. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Devils Cardigan requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on tasmanian mountain gravel to build confidence. Expect: tasmanian mountains, australian gravel, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Over Under, and Gravel Specific to prepare you for 120 miles of tasmanian mountain gravel in Tasmania, Australia.
